DataElement.preferredName: Serum Creatinine Measurement Laboratory Procedure Performed Upper Limit of Normal Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place numeric laboratory value representing the upper level of the normal range of values of serum creatinine in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serum Creatinine Measurement Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Upper Limit of Normal Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Upper Limit of Normal Integer::2 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
